SgAsmPowerpcInstruction.C

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /* SgAsmPowerpcInstruction member definitions.  Do not move them to src/ROSETTA/Grammar/BinaryInstruction.code (or any *.code
00002  * file) because then they won't get indexed/formatted/etc. by C-aware tools. */
00003 
00004 #include "sage3basic.h"
00005 #include "Disassembler.h"
00006 
00008 Disassembler::AddressSet
00009 SgAsmPowerpcInstruction::get_successors(bool *complete) {
00010     Disassembler::AddressSet retval;
00011     *complete = true; /*assume retval is the complete set of successors for now*/
00012 
00013     switch (get_kind()) {
00014         case powerpc_bc:
00015         case powerpc_bca:
00016         case powerpc_bcl:
00017         case powerpc_bcla: {
00018             /* Conditional branches: bcX BO,BI,TARGET */
00019             const std::vector<SgAsmExpression*> &exprs = get_operandList()->get_operands();
00020             ROSE_ASSERT(exprs.size()==3);
00021             ROSE_ASSERT(isSgAsmValueExpression(exprs[2]));
00022             SgAsmValueExpression *ve = isSgAsmValueExpression(exprs[2]);
00023             assert(ve!=NULL);
00024             rose_addr_t target = SageInterface::getAsmConstant(ve);
00025             retval.insert(target);
00026             retval.insert(get_address()+get_size());
00027             break;
00028         }
00029 
00030         case powerpc_bcctr:
00031         case powerpc_bcctrl:
00032         case powerpc_bclr:
00033         case powerpc_bclrl:
00034             /* Conditional branches to count register; target is unknown */
00035             *complete = false;
00036             retval.insert(get_address()+get_size());
00037             break;
00038 
00039         case powerpc_b:
00040         case powerpc_ba:
00041         case powerpc_bl:
00042         case powerpc_bla: {
00043             /* Unconditional branches */
00044             const std::vector<SgAsmExpression*> &exprs = get_operandList()->get_operands();
00045             ROSE_ASSERT(exprs.size()==1);
00046             ROSE_ASSERT(isSgAsmValueExpression(exprs[0]));
00047             SgAsmValueExpression *ve = isSgAsmValueExpression(exprs[0]);
00048             assert(ve!=NULL);
00049             rose_addr_t target = SageInterface::getAsmConstant(ve);
00050             retval.insert(target);
00051             break;
00052         }
00053 
00054         case powerpc_unknown_instruction:
00055         case powerpc_tw:
00056         case powerpc_twi:
00057         case powerpc_rfi:
00058         case powerpc_sc:
00059             /* No known successors */
00060             *complete = false;
00061             break;
00062 
00063         default:
00064             /* All others fall through to next instruction */
00065             retval.insert(get_address()+get_size());
00066             break;
00067     }
00068     return retval;
00069 }
00070 
00072 bool
00073 SgAsmPowerpcInstruction::terminatesBasicBlock() {
00074     switch (get_kind()) {
00075         case powerpc_unknown_instruction:
00076         case powerpc_b:         /* branch instructions... */
00077         case powerpc_ba:
00078         case powerpc_bl:
00079         case powerpc_bla:
00080         case powerpc_bc:
00081         case powerpc_bca:
00082         case powerpc_bcl:
00083         case powerpc_bcla:
00084         case powerpc_bcctr:
00085         case powerpc_bcctrl:
00086         case powerpc_bclr:
00087         case powerpc_bclrl:
00088         case powerpc_tw:        /* trap instructions... */
00089         case powerpc_twi:
00090         case powerpc_sc:        /* system call */
00091         case powerpc_rfi:       /* return from interrupt */
00092             return true;
00093 
00094         default:
00095             return false;
00096     }
00097 }
00098 
00100 bool
00101 SgAsmPowerpcInstruction::is_unknown() const
00102 {
00103     return powerpc_unknown_instruction == get_kind();
00104 }
